docs.snippet: A baseball fan suing the Los Angeles Dodgers and the team's former owner for $35 million could have been spared a brutal beating that left him with brain damage if the team had not skimped on security spending, a lawyer for the fan told jurors on ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A baseball fan suing the Los Angeles Dodgers and the team's former owner for $35 million could have been spared a brutal beating that left him with brain damage if the team had not skimped on security spending, a lawyer for the fan told jurors on Thursday.

headline.main: Lawyer for Badly Beaten Fan Says LA Dodgers Skimped on Security
headline.print_headline: Lawyer for Badly Beaten Fan Says LA Dodgers Skimped on Security

docs.snippet: George Springer hit a tiebreaking two-run homer in the seventh inning, and the Houston Astros extended their winning streak to six with a 3-1 victory over the Baltimore Orioles on Thursday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: George Springer hit a tiebreaking two-run homer in the seventh inning, and the Houston Astros extended their winning streak to six with a 3-1 victory over the Baltimore Orioles on Thursday night.

headline.main: Springer Homers Again, Astros Beat Orioles
headline.print_headline: Springer Homers Again, Astros Beat Orioles

docs.snippet: Dennis Mitchell, who has a history of doping, was named to lead the USA Track & Field sprint teams at the IAAF World Relays in the Bahamas last week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dennis Mitchell, who has a history of doping, was named to lead the USA Track & Field sprint teams at the IAAF World Relays in the Bahamas last week.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column deplores USA Track & Field decision to name Dennis Mitchell, who has a history of doping, the leader of its sprint teams at the IAAF World Relays in the Bahamas; says Mitchell has never publicly atoned for his doping or even attempted to prove to the fans that he has been reformed.

headline.seo: USA Track & Field Gives Dennis Mitchell, Banned for Doping in the Past, Another Chance
headline.main: Of All the Track Coaches to Bring Aboard
headline.print_headline: Of All the Track Coaches to Bring Aboard

docs.snippet: The United States should avoid getting dragged into the quicksand of international crises that have trapped some of his predecessors, President Obama said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States should avoid getting dragged into the quicksand of international crises that have trapped some of his predecessors, President Obama said on Wednesday.
docs.abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama uses commencement address to West Point cadets to mount sustained rebuttal of criticism and define approach to foreign policy that he believes is suited to a new era that he hopes will outlast his presidency; attempts to present himself as the steward of a reasonable balance between isolationism and unilateralism, but effort does not convince those critics who see him as defensive and partisan.

headline.main: Rebutting Critics, Obama Seeks Higher Bar for Military Action
headline.print_headline: Rebutting Critics, Obama Seeks Higher Bar for Military Action

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.snippet: President Obama said the United States could play a vital role in world affairs without resorting to unilateral force or retreating to isolationism....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama said the United States could play a vital role in world affairs without resorting to unilateral force or retreating to isolationism.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama lays out his foreign policy plan for his final two and a half years in office during commencement speech at West Point, calling on Congress to finance a fund to help besieged countries train in counterterrorism; says that United States can play vital role in world affairs without resorting to unilateral force or retreating to isolationism.

headline.main: Obama Warns U.S. Faces Diffuse Terrorism Threats
headline.print_headline: Obama Warns U.S. Faces Diffuse Terrorism Threats

docs.snippet: New York gardeners are taking on the ultimate challenge: growing peanuts. Global warming aside, it’s a dicey proposition for Yankees....
docs.lead_paragraph: New York gardeners are taking on the ultimate challenge: growing peanuts. Global warming aside, it’s a dicey proposition for Yankees.
docs.abstract: New York gardeners are attempting to grow peanuts, no easy task as conventional wisdom is that Arachis hypogaea plant cannot be cultivated in city.
